Now that you have an idea of what Directed Situations are, let's look at some more examples.

You see an old man sitting on the side of the street. He is holding a note requesting assistance. What does the note say?

Suggested Responses
¿Puede ayudarme usted a comprar comida?

Can you help me buy food?


You are shopping and go to the section where your favourite food is kept. However, you find the shelves empt and a notice informing customers of a problem with the item. What does the notice say?

Suggested Responses
Este producto ya no está disponible

This product is no longer available

Nuestros oreos están agotados

Our oreos are currently out of stock


You are walking through the lobby of a hotel while the floor is being mopped. What sign do you see to alert guests?

Suggested Responses
Cuidado, piso mojado

Caution, wet floor

Precaución, piso mojado posible

Caution, wet floor possible


One of your classmates is ill at home, but wishes to do the Spanish assignment. What do you write in the note you send with his/her neighbour?

Suggested Responses
¿Puede ayudar usted a Sean con la tarea?

Can you help Sean with the assignment?


You have just heard that your cousin's wedding, which you were to attend, has been called off. Write the text message you send expressing your disappointment.

Suggested Responses
Yo lamento escuchar tu boda fue cancelada

I'm sorry to hear that your wedding was cancelled
